localize.title: Buzzing on Product Hunt
localize.description: See what's buzzing on Product Hunt in your native language

nodes.excerpt: A small JS library to dynamically change the favicon of your site to show notification badges, or images and videos.
nodes.title: favico.js - Superpower your favicon with badges, images or videos
nodes.author: Abdelilah Hicham

nodes.excerpt: Refine offers lots of out-of-the box functionality for rapid development, without compromising extreme customizability. It ships with Ant Design System, an enterprise-level UI toolkit. Integrated with Supabase, Strapi, Hasura, Auth0, NextJs and more.
nodes.title: refine.dev - React-framework to build data-intensive applications quickly
nodes.author: Jai

nodes.excerpt: Publish Instagram posts directly from Notion with the unique scheduling feature that enables you to plan and publish posts automatically.
nodes.title: InstaPost - Publish & schedule Instagram posts from Notion with ease
nodes.author: Yudax

nodes.excerpt: Now you can have the latest MacBook Pr for free! Hover to reveal the quit button. That's it!
nodes.title: Notch Simulator - Pretend you have the latest MacBook Pro
nodes.author: megabits

nodes.excerpt: Crane is a docker image builder to approach light-weight ML users who want to expand a container image with custom apt/conda/pip packages without writing any Dockerfile.
nodes.title: Crane - An easy and beautiful way to build container images
nodes.author: Aaron Huang

nodes.excerpt: Create a new production-ready project with backend (Golang), frontend (JavaScript, TypeScript) and deploy automation (Ansible, Docker) by running one CLI command. Focus on writing code and thinking of business-logic! The CLI will take care of the rest.
nodes.title: Create Go App - Create a new production-ready project by one CLI command
nodes.author: Vic ShÃ³stak

nodes.excerpt: Neat streamlines notification management for GitHub. It empowers high-performing teams to review, merge, and ship code with ease. Users can preview, triage, and jump to notifications without having to leave their screen. Available for free on macOS.
nodes.title: Neat - Supercharge your GitHub workflow
nodes.author: Hiten Shah

nodes.excerpt: mixmello is a free, open source tool to create remixed versions of your favourite playlists. Search for the Spotify playlist you want to remix, tailor the remixes to your liking (with song previews), then save the playlist with a single click.
nodes.title: mixmello - Create remixed versions of your favourite Spotify playlists
nodes.author: Alex Gurr

nodes.excerpt: AskOverflow let you ask questions to StackOverflow without leaving your editor.
nodes.title: AskOverflow - Ask questions to StackOverflow directly from inside VS Code
nodes.author: Fabio Sabbion

nodes.excerpt: A Visual Studio Code extension that organizes your React app's components into an interactive tree in the sidebar. It shows parent-child relationships, props, navigates to the file where a component is defined, and marks any nodes connected to the Redux store.
nodes.title: Sapling - A convenient way to traverse your React app
nodes.author: Lindsay Baird

nodes.excerpt: Rowy is an open-source low-code platform to build your product, from MVP to scale ğŸš€ Manage your database in a spreadsheet-like UI, write Cloud Functions effortlessly in the browser, build automation with ready-made extensions to your favorite tools, and more.
nodes.title: Rowy - Airtable like simplicity with GCP's scalability
nodes.author: Harini Janakiraman

nodes.excerpt: HOST3 is the #1 AppFi DEX on Solana for hackers with AppToken exchange, web hosting, analytics, monetization and fundings. * Easy to deploy web apps from GitHub repository * Perfect for raising funds for indie app development!
nodes.title: HOST3 | #1 DEX for AppFi on Solana - AppToken exchange, web hosting, and fundings for WebApp
nodes.author: fuyutarow

nodes.excerpt: Embeddinghub is an open-source vector database for machine learning embeddings. Most modern machine learning is built atop embeddings, and Embeddinghub is built from the ground up to get your ML models out of the lab and into production.
nodes.title: Embeddinghub - An open-source database for machine learning
nodes.author: Kevin William David

nodes.excerpt: Run the latest VS Code on a remote machine accessed through a modern web browser - from any device, from anywhere. The open-source project is officially backed by GitLab, VMware, Uber, SAP, RStudio, Sourcegraph and many others.
nodes.title: OpenVSCode Server - VS Code in the browser for everyone
nodes.author: Nick Abouzeid

nodes.excerpt: Context Note is a free chrome extension that help you take notes on the web with their context. With the context, we could understand and recall the details of the notes better while reviewing. A handy tag system is also provided to manage the notes neatly.
nodes.title: Context Note - take notes on the web with their context
nodes.author: Jim Chan

nodes.excerpt: A simple open-source product that generates a daily digest of top performing products on Product Hunt directly to your Slack.
nodes.title: Product Hunt Digest - An unofficial daily digest of top products from PH to Slack
nodes.author: Ran Ribenzaft

nodes.excerpt: Tkinter Designer was created to speed up the GUI development process in Python. It uses the well-known design software Figma to make creating beautiful Tkinter GUIs in Python a piece of cake. It also comes with a CLI to make things more easier.
nodes.title: Tkinter Designer - No-code solution for Python GUI's
nodes.author: Parth jadhav

nodes.excerpt: A cross-platform application developed withNET Core to generate NFT's through a graphical interface. Simple as that, in the best Grab & Go style.
nodes.title: NFT.net - Open source NFT generator through a graphical interface
nodes.author: Aditya

nodes.excerpt: Fast Spotify client with native GUI, without Electron, built in Rust. Very early in development, lacking in features, stability, and general user experience. It is being tested only on Mac so far, but aims for full Windows and Linux support.
nodes.title: PSST - Fast and multi-platform Spotify client with native GUI
nodes.author: Seto El Kahfi

nodes.excerpt: Offline text to speech is a minimalistic website that can speak any text you input and it can do this offline!
nodes.title: Offline Text To Speech - Open source website that can speak what you type!
nodes.author: Virej Dasani

nodes.excerpt: Badaso is an API & platform builder, its also called "low code development platform" or "lcpd". Badaso help developers build their application 10x faster, even more. Also the important things, Badaso is open source and 100% free !
nodes.title: Badaso - Build apps faster with this API & platform builder
nodes.author: Rizki Heryandi

nodes.excerpt: Styler is the next gen custom CSS builder developed to supercharge your hashnode blog. Styler comes with awesome features like Live Preview, Dark Mode Support, Breakpoints support, templates and much more to standout out your blog.
nodes.title: Styler - Next-gen CSS builder in the web for Hashnode blogs
nodes.author: Savio Martin

nodes.excerpt: - âœ‹ Your real raised hand will be synchronized with the action of the raise button in Google Meet. - ğŸ” All processing is done within the browser. No image data will be sent to the any server.
nodes.title: Sync Raise Hand - Your Raised hand will be synchronized with the Google Meet
nodes.author: Kawamata Ryo

nodes.excerpt: This app will make your macOS open links in the most recently used web browser, instead of a single "default" one. It is useful if you switch between multiple browsers from time to time, especially as a web developer.
nodes.title: Overbrowsered - Open links in the browser you used most recently
nodes.author: Brian Misiak

nodes.excerpt: Responsivize is an open-source desktop app that you can use to develop responsive websites! In the app, you can test your web apps on popular iPhones, Android phones, iPads, MacBooks, and you can even set custom dimension devices!
nodes.title: Responsivize - A must-have tool to develop responsive websites

nodes.excerpt: Manage and view YouTube comments with timestamps efficiently.
nodes.title: Tempus - A tool to efficiently view YouTube comments with timestamps
nodes.author: Sarthak Mangla

nodes.excerpt: Jumpskip is a Chrome Extension for Netflix that helps you watch movies without being scared by jumpscares. Skip, mute, get a warning when jumpscares are about to happen, view all the jumpscare timestamps, and much more.
nodes.title: Jumpskip for Netflix - Watch movies on Netflix without the jumpscares
nodes.author: Alyssa X

nodes.excerpt: Lexicon is a customizable, open-source mobile app that provides an elegant mobile discussions experience. Built on Discourse, an open-source platform for communities. Fork Lexicon, connect it to your existing Discorse instance, and ship it to the App store!
nodes.title: Lexicon - An open-source, customizable mobile app for communities

nodes.excerpt: GitNFT lets developers mint NFTs of their GitHub commits and seamlessly list them in the OpenSea marketplace! Minting costs are on the house ğŸº
nodes.title: GitNFT - Autograph and sell your GitHub commits as NFTs

nodes.excerpt: Are you looking for a command-line interface (CLI) to configure and manage authentication and single sign-on for your web and mobile apps? Weâ€™re now introducing LoginRadius CLI. Put your hoodies on like a hacker!
nodes.title: LoginRadius CLI - Command Line to Configure and Manage Authentication

nodes.excerpt: Grub is an open-source & 100% free UberEats UI clone in Java/Kotlin for Android, iOS, Desktop & Web. It helps to build an elaborate cross-platform food delivery app such as UberEats, Foodpanda, GrubHub etc using a single codebase. â € â­ â €Star us on https://github.com/sergeyCodenameOne/UberEatsClone
nodes.title: Grub - Open-source food delivery app template in Java/Kotlin

nodes.excerpt: FOAAS (Fuck Off As A Service) provides a modern, RESTful, scalable solution to the common problem of telling people to fuck off.
nodes.title: FOAAS v2.3.1 - F*** Off As A Service

nodes.excerpt: 87% faster CI/CD adoption time by teams Even the most complicated CI/CD workflows take minutes to create. Buddy is DevOps adoption winner. 12 seconds of average deployment time Smart changes detection, state-of-the-art caching, parallelism, and optimisations
nodes.title: Buddy - Get the fastest CI/CD to build better apps faster
nodes.author: Ravi Sethia

nodes.excerpt: Mapus is an open source tool to explore and annotate collaboratively on a map. You can draw, add markers, lines, areas, find places to go, observe other users, and much more.
nodes.title: Mapus - Open source map tool with real-time collaboration

nodes.excerpt: Slickr is the most powerful and the easiest app to create beautiful cover images for your hashnode blog. Slickr lets you be flexible by handling backgrounds, gradients, patterns, images, icons, bookmarks, uploads and a lot more.
nodes.title: Slickr - Powerful cover image generator for your Hashnode blog

nodes.excerpt: Refined Zapier is a free open source browser extension to improve the user experience of Zapier. We've enhanced styling, search, and navigation to help power users move faster and stay organized.
nodes.title: Refined Zapier - Open-source browser extension to improve Zapier's UX
nodes.author: Zach Waterfield

nodes.excerpt: Notea is a Self hosted Note taking app stored on S3, that you can deploy with one click to Vercel, AWS, or deploy with Docker ğŸ³. It supports storage in Amazon S3, MinIO, Aliyun OSS and others. It's powered by TypeScript ğŸš€ and loves Mark Down.
nodes.title: Notea - Free self-hosted open source note taking app, like Notion
nodes.author: Bharadwaj Giridhar

nodes.excerpt: Monitor your development flow in one place from all your usual tools. Sorted & prioritized clean data aggregated in actionable automated boards. Easily track issues, PRs & actions required across your team and collaborate effectively on hot development tasks.
nodes.title: Keypup 2.0 - Development streamlining & get pull requests under control
nodes.author: Stephane Ibos

nodes.excerpt: With these design patterns by Juro and Stefania Passera, you can turn boring legal text into a transparent, engaging document that people can actually read.
nodes.title: Privacy Policy Template by Juro - Get a privacy policy people can actually read
nodes.author: Christoph Janz

nodes.excerpt: Never forget a section for your readme again! Select sections to add to your readme, edit the contents, and drag to rearrange. See a live-updating rendered preview of your markdown, then download your README.md file!
nodes.title: readme.so - Easily create the perfect readme for your project
nodes.author: Katherine Peterson

nodes.excerpt: Lip Gloss a Go library for designing terminal user interfaces. It takes an expressive, declarative approach to terminal rendering. Users familiar with CSS will feel right at home with Lip Gloss.
nodes.title: Lip Gloss - Design terminal user interfaces
nodes.author: Christian Rocha

nodes.excerpt: Developers have been using the Grouparoo UI to set up automated data movement from their databases to cloud-based tools like Mailchimp. Grouparoo now supports declarative code to set up this pipeline so you manage data sync just like you would any other app.
nodes.title: Grouparoo 2.0 - Integrate with marketing tools using low-code configuration
nodes.author: Hiten Shah

nodes.excerpt: Spaceman is an application for macOS that allows you to view your Spaces in the menu bar. Spaceman allows you to see which space you are currently on relative to the other spaces you have. Naming these spaces is also an option.
nodes.title: Spaceman - A macOS app to view virtual desktops in the menu bar
nodes.author: Jay

nodes.excerpt: I am a forgetful person. Many times after I open my MacBook and scan some news, I totally forget what I initially try to accomplish. I want to build a simple tool to display my current goal on the menu bar
nodes.title: One Goal - Makes your goal more visible by showing it on the menu bar
nodes.author: timqian

nodes.excerpt: Collect your avatar from different parts. The code of this program is very easy, any developer will be able to understand the code. SVG is used to draw an avatar. Demo version of the project: https://avatar-maker-vue.netlify.app/
nodes.title: Avatar Maker - Create your own avatar
nodes.author: David Voskanyan

nodes.excerpt: The Awesome lists on GitHub are great, but it's hard to know which projects are actively maintained and sift through them all easily. I built this tool to help me visualize and query all of the cool resources people put together.
nodes.title: Awesome Viewer - Visualize all of Github's awesome lists
nodes.author: Aryaman Sharda

nodes.excerpt: Gladys Assistant is an open-source home automation software. It's easy to install on a Raspberry Pi, a NAS, or any machine running Linux.
nodes.title: Gladys Assistant v4 - A privacy-first, open-source home assistant
nodes.author: Pierre-Gilles

nodes.excerpt: A simple and elegant desktop application for managing your Laravel applications. - Execute Artisan commands easily in a nice interface. - Tinker with your project in a magical code editor.
nodes.title: Laravel Kit - Desktop Laravel admin panel app with no configuration needs
nodes.author: Tareque Md Hanif

nodes.excerpt: Serverless Invoices is a free tool for invoice generating and management - no signup needed. Truly serverless, your data is safe with you in your browser. Export/import your invoices. It's open source, easy to modify, easy to deploy.
nodes.title: Serverless Invoices - Free, serverless invoice generator - open sourced
nodes.author: Marek

nodes.excerpt: Formst is a JavaScript library for structuring and validating forms in React. It is based on MobX-State-Tree which makes it simple and performant and it is built on the principles of "UI as an afterthought".
nodes.title: Formst - Model-driven form library for React
nodes.author: Gaurav Guha

nodes.excerpt: Terminhack lets you pretend to be a hacker running real penetration testing tools. You can run it directly from the website or from your terminal!
nodes.title: Terminhack - Impress your friends by pretending to be a real hacker ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»
nodes.author: Sandoche

However, the ones we use are owned by big corporations. ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’» So we created a growing set that you can use in your brands, products, and presentations â†’ https://sensa.co/emoji ğŸ We are giving away a custom emoji among our Twitter followers, like the Mr. Hoover one!
nodes.title: Sensa Emoji - Free, vector, and open-source emoji set
nodes.author: Manu Gamero

nodes.excerpt: A small app for making quick flowcharts from text â¿».
nodes.title: flowchart.fun - An open-source tool for generating flowcharts from text
nodes.author: Mehmet Akyol

nodes.excerpt: Athens is an open-source and local-first alternative to Roam Research. Athens is the most powerful and transparent knowledge graph.
nodes.title: Athens Research - Open-source, local-first Roam Research
nodes.author: Jeff Tang

nodes.excerpt: Global.health is a collaborative effort by technologists and researchers from leading international institutions to build a trusted, detailed, and accurate resource of real-time infectious disease data.
nodes.title: Global.health - Access data about 5M+ anonymized COVID-19 cases
nodes.author: Chris Messina

nodes.excerpt: The easiest way to build simple, powerful websites with nothing but Notion. Turn your Notion pages into fast, functional websites in minutes with free subdomain, custom google fonts, custom javascript code, pretty URLs, search engine optimization, and more.
nodes.title: Notion Dog  - Turn your Notion pages into websites in minutes
nodes.author: åˆ˜å®‡ç¿”

nodes.excerpt: The Developerâ€™s Homepage ___ Hackertab, a handy extension to help developers stay up-to-date with the latest tech happenings. Itâ€™s fully customizable, for frontend, backend, full-stack, mobile, data scientistsâ€¦ bref, for all developers.
nodes.title: Hackertab.dev - Hottest programming trends right in your tab ğŸ”¥
nodes.author: Mehdi Sakout

nodes.excerpt: YoMo is an open-source Streaming Serverless Framework for building low-latency edge computing applications. Built atop QUIC transport protocol and functional reactive programming interface, it makes real-time data processing reliable, secure, and easy.
nodes.title: YoMo - A serverless framework for latency sensitive applications
nodes.author: YonaCao

nodes.excerpt: SigNoz is an open-source alternative to DataDog. We help developers find issues in the software they run on cloud and solve them quickly. Run SigNoz in your infrastructure and get your application monitoring setup at 10x lower cost
nodes.title: SigNoz - Open source alternative to Datadog
nodes.author: Michael Seibel

nodes.excerpt: SST (Serverless Stack) is a framework that makes it easy to build serverless apps. It features: -- - A Live Lambda Development environment - Zero-config support for ES and TypeScript - Higher-level constructs designed for serverless
nodes.title: SST - Work on your serverless apps live
nodes.author: Michael Seibel

nodes.excerpt: Infracost is an open source cloud cost estimator in pull requests. When you change your infrastructure code (Terraform), we post a comment in the pull request, telling you the impact to your cloud bill, e.g. â€œthis will increase your bill by 25% next monthâ€.
nodes.title: Infracost - Open source cloud cost estimator in pull requests
nodes.author: Michael Seibel

nodes.excerpt: Our serverless Kubernetes platform is designed for the needs of fast moving development teams who want to focus on delivering applications, not operations.
nodes.title: CTO.ai 2.0 - A smarter workflow for Cloud Native apps
nodes.author: Hiten Shah

nodes.excerpt: Remotion allows you to make real MP4 videos written in React. Use web technologies like CSS, SVG, WebGL to make interesting motion graphics. Use programming to dynamically make different variants of videos and automate it using server-side rendering.
nodes.title: Remotion - Create videos programmatically in React
nodes.author: Jonny Burger

nodes.excerpt: Translate words straight from your Alfred launcher: - Open Alfred - Type a language combination and a word: `fren fromage` - Press enter to open the results page on WordReference! Get access to 48 dictionaries across 18 different languages!
nodes.title: WordReference for Alfred - Multilingual translations at your fingertips!
nodes.author: Alex Martin

nodes.excerpt: Powered by tens of thousands of popular fully responsive visuals, SYQEL VJ is a simple to use desktop application that enables users to instantly visualize their mic or desktop audio feeds & easily use it as a window source in OBS or other broadcasting apps.
nodes.title: SYQEL VJ - Automatic responsive visuals for your streams
nodes.author: Chris Messina

nodes.excerpt: This extension attempts to recover your suspended Great Suspender tabs by searching your browser history and displaying any found suspended tabs. You can then: - adjust grouping, sorting and detail - save as folders and bookmarks - copy URLs to the clipboard
nodes.title: The Great Suspender Recovery Tool - Recover your lost Great Suspender tabs
nodes.author: Dave Stewart

nodes.excerpt: Pika (pronounced piÂ·kuh, like picker) is an easy to use, open-source, native colour picker for macOS. Pika makes it simple to quickly find colours on screen, in the format you need, so you can get on with being a speedy, successful designer.
nodes.title: Pika - An open-source colour picker app for macOS
nodes.author: Chris Messina

nodes.excerpt: Tiny stocks watcher for the menu bar. Add your favorite tickers to always see the current price. Powered by Yahoo Finance API. Buy on the Mac App Store for $0.99 or free install via Xcode. For any further information or features, feel free to contact me.
nodes.title: Market Bar - Tiny stocks watcher
nodes.author: Daniil M.

nodes.title: Chat for VSCode - Chat with your Slack and Discord teams from within VS Code

nodes.title: Gleek - Free online diagramming tool for developers

nodes.excerpt: Firefox Relay makes it easy to create aliases, randomly generated email addresses that forward to your real inbox. Use it to protect your online accounts - and your identity - from hackers.
nodes.title: Firefox Relay - Hide your real email address to help protect your identity.
nodes.author: qztn

nodes.excerpt: Music Time is built on the Code Time plugin and performs machine learning against a range of music metrics plus productivity data from over 70,000 developers to determine song recommendations.
nodes.title: Music Time for Spotify - Discover the most productive music to listen to as you code.
nodes.author: Abdelilah Hicham

nodes.excerpt: Ship faster and improve team satisfaction with engineering analytics powered by your Github data. -- â†’ Visualize the entire delivery process from commit to deploy â†’ Highlight bottlenecks like code review â†’ Spot issues like feature delays and team burnout.
nodes.title: Haystack - Ship faster and improve dev happiness
nodes.author: Gustaf AlstrÃ¶mer

nodes.excerpt: GitWrapped allows you to view the statistics of your Github profile over the years, the amount of lines you wrote, how many pull requests you closed and more! Compare stats with your friends and show off on social media! #GitWrapped #Wrapped #Github2020
nodes.title: GitWrapped - View/Share how you contributed to Github over the years
nodes.author: DanCodes

nodes.excerpt: dev-flow is a website where you can view any person's GitHub statistics and timeline by entering their GitHub username.
nodes.title: dev-flow - View GitHub statistics and timeline by username.
nodes.author: Alper KARATAÅ

nodes.excerpt: Project Lightspeed is a self contained live streaming server. With Lightspeed you will be able to deploy your own sub-second latency streaming site. The Lightspeed repository contains the instructions for installing and deploying the entire application.
nodes.title: Project Lightspeed - a sub-second, open source, self hosted stream from OBS
nodes.author: Garrett Graves

nodes.excerpt: Metrics generates infographics about you so you can embed them on your GitHub profile to let other users know more about you. Display your git stats along with an isometric calendar, favorites music, website performances, last tweets, projects, languages,..
nodes.title: GitHub Metrics - Customize your profile with various plugins and metrics
nodes.author: Simon L.

nodes.excerpt: Ever spent hours training ML models only to have them crash and burn in production? ZenML is here to help. Track metadata, compare results, and scale to the cloud. Itâ€™s open-source, extensible, and integrates with battle-tested MLOps tooling off-the-shelf.
nodes.title: ZenML - Create reproducible machine learning pipelines
nodes.author: David Aronchick

nodes.excerpt: Meteostat is a meteorological database which provides historical weather and climate data for thousands of weather stations and places worldwide. The project features a convenient web app and data interfaces for developers.
nodes.title: Meteostat - Historical weather and climate data
nodes.author: Christian Lamprecht
